meanings.definition: Containing or full of dirt, sediment, or impurities.
meanings.sent1: The pond water looked feculent with all the mud and leaves floating in it.
meanings.sent2: The old well had become feculent over time, making the water undrinkable.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped a handful of soil into the soup, giving it a feculent flavor.
meanings.sent4: The city streets after the rain were feculent with debris and trash.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house was filled with a feculent smell of decay and neglect.

meanings.sent1: The dumpster behind the restaurant emitted a feculent odor that made people gag.
meanings.sent2: The public restroom was so feculent that no one wanted to use it.
meanings.sent3: The prankster placed a feculent-smelling candle in the office, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The swamp was a feculent breeding ground for mosquitoes and other pests.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled food left in the fridge had turned into a feculent mess.
